title: Coelho Diniz family raises stake in Brazil's GPA, moves for new board election
description: RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) -Brazilian food retailer GPA said on Sunday it will hold a meeting to decide whether to dismiss its entire board of directors, as the firm granted a request by the Coelho Diniz family which has increased its stake in the company to 24.6%.  The family request seeks to elect new board members that would better represent their new shareholding position, GPA said in a filing, as it becomes a majority shareholder on the firm.  In a separate statement to the market, also on Sunday, GPA said Andre Luiz Coelho Diniz, Alex Sandro Coelho Diniz, Fabio Coelho Diniz, Henrique Mulford Coelho Diniz, and Helton Coelho Diniz reported that their combined holdings reached 24.6% of the total common shares issued by the company, which owns the Pao de Acucar chain, one of the largest in Brazil.
content:
RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) -Brazilian food retailer GPA said on Sunday it will hold a meeting to decide whether to dismiss its entire board of directors, as the firm granted a request by the Coelho Diniz family which has increased its stake in the company to 24.6%.

The family request seeks to elect new board members that would better represent their new shareholding position, GPA said in a filing, as it becomes a majority shareholder on the firm.

In a separate statement to the market, also on Sunday, GPA said Andre Luiz Coelho Diniz, Alex Sandro Coelho Diniz, Fabio Coelho Diniz, Henrique Mulford Coelho Diniz, and Helton Coelho Diniz reported that their combined holdings reached 24.6% of the total common shares issued by the company, which owns the Pao de Acucar chain, one of the largest in Brazil.

Citing the unanimous support expressed by the members of the board of directors for the convening of the meeting, GPA said it will take measures to convene it within the legal deadline.
summary: Brazilian food retailer, GPA, will hold a meeting to decide whether to dismiss its entire board of directors following a request from the Coelho Diniz family. The family has increased its stake in the company to 24.6%, making it a majority of the total common shares issued by the company. The meeting is set to take place within the legal deadline.
shortSummary: The Coelho Diniz family has increased its stake in Brazil's GPA to 24.6%, seeking to elect more members of staff.
argos_summary: Brazilian food retailer GPA announced it will convene a meeting to decide whether to dismiss its entire board of directors after the Coelho Diniz family increased its stake to 24.6%. The family seeks to elect new board members that better reflect their majority position. GPA said the board unanimously supports the meeting and will arrange it within the legal deadline.
